Message.Title: Yahoo has raised Ebay's target to $55.56
Message.Msg: Yahoo has raised Ebay's target to $$55.56 After earnings Ebay will be at $60.00 with a target of $67.50

Topic.Title: I've officially called buying on ebay Quits!

Message.Msg: Contact the seller and let them know what happened and if they can cancel the bid which i am sure they can do and then you can resubmit the bid. You won't get good customer service from ebay. Their job is to ignore everything you say and hope you just leave them alone. When I had the paypal issue I contacted the sellers and they were all very kind and patient and worked with me. Ebay customer service on the other hand was not willing to work with me. I'm switching my buying now on EBID and Amazon, In December I spent $3000 on ebay alone so I'm sure my spending on EBID and Amazon will have some impact and hopefully encourage sellers to sell more there and perhaps lower their start prices thus drawing in more buyers.

The government, and everyone else, is certainly keeping the money away from you failed Daddy, failed Grand Daddy! You're so broke even the Green Mohaves sometimes want to toss you a penny, but mostly they just want to bite you, if you'd ever dare step out of that rusty trailer...........
But failed Daddy failed Granddaddy, if you 'kick the bucket' what will Uncle Flyktning use to clean up all your 12 years of daily spamming puke on aisle 5?
